thailand: SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat; PENINSULAR: Trang, Songkhla.
distribution: Laos, Vietnam, Peninsular Malaysia, New Guinea, Australia.
ecology: Moist, sandy soil, 100 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Uttaradit; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Sakhon Nakhon, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Prachin Buri, Chon Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Ranong, Surat Thani, Phangnga, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Narathiwat.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Khon Kaen.
distribution: Old World Tropics from W Africa to Australia, though not recorded for Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam or Myanmar.
ecology: In wet, usually open places, often amongst grass probably in a variety of habitats certainly including paddy fields, not recorded for Thailand. Flowering and fruiting: mainly in December.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Udon Thani, Sakhon Nakhon, Mukdahan.
distribution: Africa, Madagascar, India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nepal, Myanmar, Vietnam, China, Peninsular Malaysia, New Guinea, Aru Island.
ecology: Muddy, wet or wet grassy open habitats, 900–1,100 m alt. Principally flowering and fruiting: October–January.

thailand: SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo; PENINSULAR: Ranong.
ecology: Mossy and grassy slopes by stream and in evergreen forests, 100 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: December.

thailand: Doubtfully recorded from SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo (Aranyaprathet) see notes below.
ecology: On wet sand (Pierre 3348 (P)).

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Uttaradit, Phitsanulok; NORTH EASTERN: Loei, Sakhon Nakhon, Mukdahan, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram, Ubon Ratchathani; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Chon Buri, Chanthaburi; Trat; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Phangnga, Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Narathiwat.
ecology: Wet, marshy often sandy and often acidic ground, occasionally on wet rocks, rarely in shallow water; most frequently recorded from 300–600 m alt., but ranging from (0–)200–1,300 m. Flowering and fruiting: mainly August–January.

thailand: SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat (Ko Chang – type: Schmidt 704a, lectotype -C, isolectotype -K).
ecology: Sandy banks, wet rocks and paddy fields, 0–150 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: mainly March–May and September–November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Angka [Doi Inthanon], Pa Ngem S peak 2200 m – type: Garrett 437, holotype BM, isotype -K); NORTH-EASTERN: Loei.
ecology: Wet rocks at high altitude, sometimes in evergreen forests, 2,200 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: September–November.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Sakhon Nakhon, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Surin, Si Sa Ket; SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat.
ecology: Wet places, on rocks by streams, by paddy fields, sometimes on sandy soil, 100–400 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: May till November.

thailand: e-Flora of Thailand
NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei.
ecology: On rocks in streams and rivers, 800–1,100 m alt. Flowering and fruiting throughout the year.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat, Songkhla.
distribution: India, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Vietnam, China, Peninsular Malaysia, Korea, Japan, Sumatra, Java, Borneo, New Guinea, New Caledonia, Australia.
ecology: Open, wet, moist and sandy areas, marshes and swamps, rarely on rock in streams, 50–500(–1,200) m alt. Flowering and fruiting: May–August and occasionally through until January.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai.
ecology: Wet, mossy rock, 1,650 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; EASTERN: Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Chon Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Phangnga, Songkhla, Pattani, Narathiwat.
distribution: India, Sri Lanka, Myanmar, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, China, Japan, Peninsular Malasia, Sumatra, Borneo (Sarawak, Sabah), the Philippines, New Guinea (West Papua, PNG), Australia.
ecology: Moist or wet open areas usually on sandy soil, 0–1,300 m alt. Principally flowering and fruiting: August–December.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Sakhon Nakhon, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chon Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat.
ecology: In wet places, often on sandy soil, occasionally on rocks, in paddy fields and in wet places in deciduous dipterocarp and evergreen forests, 20–1,400 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: mainly from September through till December, but mainly in November and December.

thailand: SOUTH-EASTERN: Rayong, Chanthaburi; PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Phangnga, Phuket, Trang, Narathiwat.
distribution: Myanmar, Vietnam, China, Peninsular Malaysia, Sumatra, Borneo.
ecology: Still water in marshes and canals (khlongs), by the edges of swamp forests, 0–50 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: December–March.

ecology: Elsewhere in its range, still or flowing water of various depths, most commonly at low altitude.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Nan, Lampang, Phitsanulok, Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Sakon Nakhon, Nakhon Phanom; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram, Surin, Si Sa Ket, Ubon Ratchathani; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; CENTRAL: Chai Nat, Ang Thong, Phra Nakhon Si Ayutthaya, Saraburi, Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok); SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Chon Buri, Rayong, Chanthaburi; PENINSULAR: Ranong, Surat Thani, Phangnga, Phuket, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Trang, Songkhla, Pattani, Narathiwat.
ecology: In still water in roadside ditches, rice paddies, freshwater swamps and marshes, ponds, reservoirs and canals, most frequently recorded from altitude below 200 m but reaching 1,100 m. Flowering and fruiting throughout the year.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Sakon Nakhon; CENTRAL: Lop Buri; PENINSULAR: Songkhla.
distribution: Widespread, essentially pantropical, extending northward into E & W America, and into SW Europe and the eastern Mediterranean, China, Japan and S America.
ecology: In ponds, ditches, marshes, 2–1,300 m alt. Flowering and fruiting throughout the year.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Phatthalung.
distribution: From Thailand and Peninsular Malaysia to New Guinea.
ecology: Lowland evergreen forests, including swamp forests and coral limestone, soil over limestone, sea level to 500 m (140 m in Thailand).

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type of Delphinium stapeliosmum var. siamense ), Tak.
ecology: In open rocky places, mainly on limestone or granite, rhizomes penetrating into crevices of rocks, 1,300–2,100 m alt. Flowering: September–December; fruiting: November–January. Rare species of Northern districts.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Nakhon Phanom (Tha Uten – syntypes of Naravelia axillaris var. grandiflora ); CENTRAL: Krung Thep Maha Nakhon (Bangkok) (syntypes of N. dasyoneura var. siamensis ); PENINSULAR: Surat Thani, Pattani-Yala (type of N. axillaris var. paniculata ).
distribution: Indochina, Malay Peninsular, Java, Borneo (type), the Philippines.
ecology: Growing on bushes in open sunny places, river banks, wastelands, in lowlands up to ca 200 m alt. Flowering: February–July; fruiting: April–September. This plant seems to have decreased greatly in Thailand to judge by the fact that there are no recent collections.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep-syntype, Mae Taeng – syntype, Mae Samoeng-syntype), Nakorn Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Sakon Nakhon; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi (Ban Pang – syntype); CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat.
ecology: Climbing on shrubs or trees at edges of deciduous or mixed forests, up to ca 800 m alt. Flowering: August–November; fruiting: September–January.

thailand: NORTHERN: Lampang; NORTH-EASTERN: Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima, Buri Ram; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chon Buri, Chanthaburi, Trat; CENTRAL: Saraburi, Nakhon Nayok; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Ranong, Surat Thani, Nakhon Si Thamarat, Trang, Pattani, Chumphon.
ecology: Climbing on trees in evergreen forests, sometimes in open areas, up to 500 m alt. Flowering: mostly from March–September; fruiting: mostly October–February, but the seasons vary.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan.
ecology: Climbing in evegreen forests, lowland, up to 200 m alt. Rather rare in Thailand.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type of Clematis wattii , Doi Pa Khao – type of C. wattii , Doi Inthanon – type of C. wattii ), Chiang Rai.
distribution: Kashmir, Nepal (type), Bhutan, Myanmar, China (Yunnan), Indochina.
ecology: Climbing on bushes along the edges of evergreen or mixed forests, or scattered on grassy slopes, 1,000–2,100 m alt. Flowering: November–February; fruiting: January–March, but seasons are not strictly fixed.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep – type of Clematis siamensis ).
ecology: Climbing on bushes, or at forests edges, 700–2,500 m alt. Flowering: November–March; fruiting: January–March, but seasons sometimes not exactly fixed.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai.
ecology: Climbing at edges of evergreen forests or on bushes, often along streams, 1,000–1,500 m alt. Flowering: October–December; fruiting: February–March. Rare species of Northern provinces.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Phrae (Huai Le Lami – type of Clematis smilacifolia var. grandiflora ); NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Ta Kanun – type of C. smilacifolia var. angustifolia ).
distribution: SE Tibet, Himalayas: Nepal, Eastern India, Bangladesh (type), Myanmar, China (Yunnan, Guizhou, Hainan), Indochina, Malesia, eastwards to New Guinea.
ecology: Climbing on bushes or trees at forests edges, especially in valleys, 200– 1,800 m alt. Flowering: October–January; fruiting: December–March.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type), Loei (Phu Kradueng).
ecology: In thickets on open ridges of limestone, 1,200–2,000 m alt. Flowering: September–December; fruiting: December. Rare species in Northern provinces.

thailand: Rarely cultivated in nurseries in Bangkok and Chiang Mai.
ecology: Climbing along seashore, on grasslands, shrubs, corals, or climbing on rocky, coastal soils. Flowering: June–September; fruiting: July–October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao), Chiang Rai (Doi Tung).
ecology: Climbing on open limestone rocks, 1,300–1,800 m alt., rather rare in Thailand. Flowering: August–October; fruiting: October–January, but the seasons sometimes not strictly fixed.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei (Phu Kradueng).
distribution: Myanmar, S China (type), Indochina, the Philippines (Luzon), Taiwan, S Japan.
ecology: Climbing on bushes, or at edges of evergreen forests, 1,000–1,700 m alt. Flowering: March–May, sometimes to October; fruiting: mostly from June–December. This species is rare in Thailand, and grows in limestone areas of Northern and North-eastern provinces, though it is usually found in coastal regions outside Thailand.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Ban Pong Yeang – type), Chiang Rai, Lamphun, Mae Hong Son.
ecology: A rare plants growing in primary, evergreen forests or scrubs along valleys at 600–1,100 m alt. Flowering: November–December; fruiting: January–February.

thailand: NOTRHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type).
ecology: Climbing on buches in open evergreen or mixed forests, or open, disturbed scrubs, in limestone areas, 1,400–1,600 m alt. Flowering: October–November; fruiting: January–February. Rare species of Northern provinces.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi (Mae Krai – type of Clematis Kerriana ), Prachuap Khiri Khan.
ecology: Climbing on bushes, bamboo-thickets or secondary growths of mixed forests, in rather sunny places, up to ca 1,400 m alt. Flowering: November–February; fruiting: January–March.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Nong Khai, Nakhon Phanom.
distribution: Widely distributed in the northern hemisphere (Europe – type), south to north India, Myanmar, Indochina, and N America.
ecology: On wet ground, on river banks, up to ca 200 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: January–July. This is a rather common species but in Thailand, recent collections have not been seen.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Omkoi – type), Phitsanulok.
ecology: In open grassy forests, mostly of pine-deciduous dipterocarp forests, or abandoned rice fields, usually in swampy places, 800–1,500 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: January–July.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Nakhon Phanom.
distribution: Widely distributed in Himalayas, eastern Siberia, Myanmar, China (type), Indochina, Korea and Japan.
ecology: In open, cultivated or waste places, river banks, up to ca 200 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: January–June. Recent collections have not been seen.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai.
ecology: In open, deciduous forests, grassy fields, or on bare, rocky ground, 500– 1,800 m alt. Flowering: June–August; fruiting: August–October.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Pha Mon in Doi Inthanon).
ecology: On rock faces or rotting wood, very wet spots, ca 1,700 m alt; very rare, the only Thai collection is Garrett 400.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type).
ecology: In grassy places, on open ridges or in rock crevices in limestone, 1,600– 2,200 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: August–November. Rare, growing in Doi Chiang Dao.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Chiang Dao – type).
ecology: In grassy places or in crevices in limestone rock on open ridges, from 1,800–2,200 m alt. Flowering and fruiting: July–November. Rare plant endemic on Doi Chiang Dao.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai (Doi Suthep – type: Kerr 707, holotype -K, isotypes -BM K L), Lamphun, Lampang, Tak.
ecology: Deciduous forests with bamboo, mixed dipterocarp-oak forests, often with abundant bamboo and near streams, on granite and limestone, at 200–900 m alt. Flowering: November–March and June–August; fruiting: July and November.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Sakon Nakhon (Phu Phan NP, Tham Seri Thai cave trail – type: Inthachub 87, holotype -BKF, isotype -L), Mukdahan.
ecology: Scattered in blanket marsh vegetation on sandstone hill, dry or rarely wet area in deciduous dipterocarp forests, at ca 300 m alt. Flowering: August.

thailand: NORTH-EASTERN: Udon Thani, Nong Khai, Mukdahan; EASTERN: Surin, Si Sa Ket, Ubon Ratchathani.
ecology: Dry evergreen and dry deciduous mixed dipterocarp forests, dry rice fields; shady, sandy, often rather wet places; at 120–250 m alt. Flowering: March–August; fruiting: August.

thailand: EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; CENTRAL: Saraburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Sa Kaeo, Chon Buri (Si Racha – type: Collins 131, lectotype -K, isolectotype -BM), Chanthaburi, Trat.
ecology: Dry evergreen, dry deciduous and bamboo forests, mixed deciduous scrub and swampy thicket, rugged limestone terrain, 25–450 m alt. Flowering: January–May; fruiting: March–May.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Lamphun, Lampang, Tak, Phitsanulok; NORTH EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi; CENTRAL: Saraburi.
ecology: Deciduous dipterocarp-oak and dry dipterocarp forests, often with abundant bamboo, in shaded places and near streams, on limestone and granite bedrock, at 100–925 m alt. Flowering: February–August; fruiting: July–August.

thailand: SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Ratchaburi, Phetchaburi, Prachuap Khiri Khan; PENINSULAR: Chumphon, Surat Thani, Krabi, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Phatthalung, Trang, Satun, Songkhla, Pattani, Narathiwat.
ecology: Deciduous, evergreen and secondary forests, not far from the coast, on riverbanks, near waterfalls, in thickets and scrub; on sand, limestone and poor granitic soil, from sea level to 600 m alt. Flowering: December–July; fruiting: February–November.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai (Doi Luang NP), Sukhothai, Lampang, Phrae (Mae Tha – type: Kerr 2351, holotype -K), Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei, Udon Thani, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Ubon Ratchathani.
ecology: In dry evergreen forests, (mixed) deciduous hardwood forests with much bamboo, on shale bedrock and in rugged limestone terrain and on limestone hills, 240–700 m alt. Flowering: February–May. Quite frequently encountered flowering precociously on shorter shoots with scale-like leaves only, perhaps following burning.

thailand: NORTHERN: Sukhothai; NORTH-EASTERN: Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima (type: cultivated at Kasetsart University, Bangkok, from plants collected in Nakhon Ratchasima, Inthachub 130, holotype -BKF, isotype -L), Buri Ram; (perhaps also SOUTH WESTERN: Kanchanaburi).
ecology: In deciduous forests on rocky ground, edge of fallow fields, at 100–300 m alt. Flowering: February–March and October; fruiting: March.

thailand: NORTHERN: Nakhon Sawan; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei, Khon Kaen; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum, Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi (Mt. Talang – type: Pierre 82, holotype -P, isotype -K); SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri, Rayong, Chanthaburi.
ecology: Mixed deciduous forests; near waterfalls, on limestone and granite rocks near the coast, sea level up to (probably) over 1,000 m alt. Flowering: February–April; fruiting: September.

thailand: NORTHERN: Mae Hong Son, Chiang Mai, Phayao, Nan, Lamphun, Lampang, Uttaradit, Phitsanulok, Kamphaeng Phet; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; EASTERN: Nakhon Ratchasima; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri.
distribution: Widespread: NE India, China, Cambodia, Laos, Vietnam (type), Taiwan, through Peninsular Malaysia and Indonesia east to Ambon and the Philippines.
ecology: Deciduous hardwood and dry dipterocarp forests with lots of bamboo, primary evergreen forests, on granite and shale bedrock and limestone outcrops, at 250–1,200 m alt. Flowering: April–July and October; fruiting: May–October.

thailand: EASTERN: Surin, Si Sa Ket, Ubon Ratchathani.
ecology: Scattered in open scrub vegetation and rather wet areas of dry dipterocarp forests. Flowering: February and September.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Known only from a restricted area in Surat Thani (Khlong Phanom NP – Middleton 544, holotype -BKF, isotypes -A E L; Khlong Saeng WS).
ecology: Secondary forests on limestone, hanging from fissures in rock, 50–300 m alt.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Pattani, Yala, Narathiwat.
ecology: Wet habitats in lowland dipterocarp forests and rain forests, mostly near streams, granite bedrock and sandy places, 30–600 m alt.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Narathiwat (Hala-Bala WS – type: Inthachub 117, holotype -BKF, isotype -L).
ecology: In rainforests along streams, 30–160 m alt.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Loei; SOUTH-WESTERN: Ratchaburi; SOUTH-EASTERN: Chon Buri, Trat; PENINSULAR: Nakhon Si Thammarat, Satun, Narathiwat.
distribution: Widespread throughout tropical Asia from southern India and Sri Lanka eastwards as far as New Guinea and north to S China. For discussion of typifications see Hay, Blumea 33: 427–469. 1988.
ecology: Open wet areas in deciduous and evergreen forests, along rivers and in ditches; frequently remaining after land clearance; on a variety of substrates but not recorded from limestone.

thailand: NORTHERN: Chiang Mai, Chiang Rai, Nan, Lampang, Phrae, Sukhothai, Phitsanulok; NORTH-EASTERN: Phetchabun, Loei, Nakhon Phanom; EASTERN: Chaiyaphum; SOUTH-WESTERN: Kanchanaburi, Phetchaburi; CENTRAL: Nakhon Nayok; SOUTH-EASTERN: Prachin Buri, Chachoengsao, Chon Buri, Rayong, Chanthaburi, Trat (type of Pothos scandens f. angustior : Schmidt 853, lectotype -B, isolectotype -C); PENINSULAR: Ranong, Surat Thani, Phangnga, Phuket, Krabi, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Songkhla, Pattani.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Yala, Narathiwat.
ecology: Rainforests on rock along streams, moist evergreen forests on moderate slopes. Frequently associated with limestone or granite; 50–300 m alt.

thailand: PENINSULAR: Yala.

ecology: Seasonally dry evergreen lowland to hill forests.

ecology: Dry deciduous lowland forests.

thailand: SOUTH-EASTERN: Trat (type: Schmidt 7175 (holotype -B, isotype -C); PENINSULAR: Yala, Narathiwat.
